Upgrading The Rare CD Listings
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): CD List (North American Version ONLY): Upgrading The Rare CD Listings
By John Hawley on Saturday, April 28, 2001 - 09:28 am:

We are upgrading the Rare Cd listings and issuing a... Call For Help.
If you have a CD that creates a Rare in either Monster Rancher or Monster Rancher 2, please post the following information here:

  • UPC: the numbers under the barcode on the back
  • Catalog#: located on the case spine
  • Label: the company that put it out

Also, you can include any other info that might make a difference, like- Origin: Country printed in,or Info: Bonus tracks or special covers or Parental advisory. Anything that helps us nail down the correct pressing. Then, we'll edit them into the regular Cd listings.

If you have any questions, post them here or e-mail me from the Contacts section to the left. We have the largest listings section on the web. Now let's make it the most accurate. - All Hail, Fellow Metropolitans and Good Hunting. - John Hawley
By Lisa Shock on Sunday, May 26, 2002 - 10:27 am:

I have edited in all the old posts in this thread, and deleted them. We are still looking for detailed info on a few discs, but please, please, look at the CD list entries before posting any info. Also note if your post is about the USA/Canada (NTSC) version of the game, or the UK/AU PAL version.

By rocket on Sunday, April 6, 2008 - 04:08 pm:

i used my sister's soundtrack to "titanic" but instead of the deluxe
liner (zilla/???) indicated by lisa, it gave a regular gaboo.

By Lisa Shock on Monday, April 7, 2008 - 09:42 am:

This is known. Only one, very rare early pressing makes Deluxe Liner, the rest make Gaboos.

By Lisa Shock on Monday, April 7, 2008 - 09:48 am:

It might be useful to give us the UPC code and the little numbers from the inner ring of the disc to help us clarify.

I posted the Zilla listing when we moved, but I was never able to actually find a correct copy of the soundtrack.
